job.title: System Applications Specialist (m/w/d)
job.plaincontent:
Wer wir sind
Roche Diagnostics International AG in Rotkreuz ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter diagnostischer Systeme für Kliniken, Labors und Arztpraxen. In Rotkreuz arbeiten mehr als 2200 Personen, womit dieser Standort zu den wichtigsten von Roche Diagnostics zählt.
Roche ist ein Arbeitgeber, der für Chancengleichheit steht und ungesetzliche Diskriminierung aufgrund von Ethnizität, Hautfarbe, Religion, Geschlecht, sexueller Ausrichtung, Geschlechtsidentität und -Ausdruck, nationaler Herkunft und Abstammung, Alter, mentaler und physischer Behinderung, medizinischem Zustand, Familienstand, Armeezugehörigkeit oder jeglicher anderer Charakteristik, die gesetzlich geschützt ist, strikt verbietet und unterbindet.
Was Sie erwartet
Roche Diagnostics (Schweiz) AG in Rotkreuz ist die Schweizer Marketing-, Vertriebs- und Serviceorganisation der Division Diagnostics von Roche. Von hier aus werden Labors, Spitäler und Ärzte in der Schweiz mit Diagnostiksystemen und Dienstleistungen beliefert. Mit dieser spannenden, abwechslungsreichen Tätigkeit unterstützen Sie direkt unsere Kunden aus den Schweizer Pathologie- und Histologie-Laboren sowie den Laboren für Molekulare Diagnostik und stellen den After-Sales-Service bei Roche Diagnostics (Schweiz) AG sicher.
Ihre Hauptaufgaben umfassen:
- Kundenschulungen und Kundenbegleitung nach der Installation eines Systems für Labor Diagnostics - Troubleshooting: Analyse, Behebung der Systemstörungen, qualifizierte Bearbeitung von Kundenanfragen und korrektes Rapportieren in unseren CRM Systemen - Inbetriebnahme von Systemen nach der Installation, inkl. Gerätekonfiguration, Protokoll-Installation und Verifizierung gemäss vorgegebenen Standards - Anstreben sicherer Laborwerte aller installierter Systemen und Gewährleistung der Kundenzufriedenheit bei der Anwendung der Roche Systemlösungen bezüglich Handhabung und Ergebnisse - Schnittstelle zu den Kompetenzzentren und zu den Regionen sowie Global Customer Support (Hotline) - Mögliche Mitarbeit an übergreifenden Projekten im Rahmen eigener Erfahrungen und Ressourcen - Erfolgreiche Zusammenarbeit mit Verkauf und Service zur Sicherstellung der Umsetzung und Einhaltung der Geschäftsziele von Roche Diagnostics (Schweiz) AG
Sie bringen folgendes Profil mit:
- Naturwissenschaftliche Ausbildung oder ähnliche Qualifikationen mit Berufserfahrung im Labor, vorzugsweise im Pathologielabor und in Labor für Molekulare Diagnostik - Erfahrung in der Mikroskopie und Interpretation, sowie Erfahrung bei PCR-basierter Diagnostik - Affinität in Software Applikationen und technischen Anwendungen - Sie sind kommunikativ und kundenorientiert - Sie haben eine hohe Eigenverantwortung, sind flexibel und belastbar - Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse, gute Französich- oder Englishkenntnisse - Sie arbeiten viel vor Ort bei unseren Kunden und schätzen die damit verbundene Reisetätigkeit - Sie verfügen über eine Fahrerlaubnis der Kategorie B - Wohnsitz oder Umzugsbereitschaft in die Deutschschweiz
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Customer Support, Customer Support > Technical & Application Support

job.title: Group Business Plan Project Lead
job.plaincontent:
We believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives. We are courageous in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world.
That is why we come to work every single day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigor, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.
We are proud of who we are, what we do, and how we do it. We are many, working as one across functions, across companies, and across the world.
In this high-profile position, you will lead the annual Group Business Plan (BP) process in close collaboration with your Group Planning and Special Projects (FXE) colleagues and the broader planning network across the Roche Group. The BP includes the latest strategic and financial plans of the group and seeks to provide value-adding insights and opportunities to support Senior Management in their discussions and decision-making regarding the outlook of Roche. Further, you will be responsible for a set of corporate performance indicators that are used in the annual report and executive compensation.
Your main responsibilities include:
- Lead the annual Group Business Plan (10-year plan) and Mid-Term Outlook (3- year plan) process - Play an active role in the planning squads and networks across the Roche Group. Identify ideas and innovative approaches to optimize the planning process - Provide insight, analysis, and recommendations to be used as part of planning discussions to improve decision making. Interact with business functions to understand long term strategies and drivers of performance and how they impact the overall Group picture - Present the Business Plan to selected functions and leadership teams to enable dissemination of insights into the Roche organisation - Responsible for specific corporate KPIs (e.g. TSR, Group Planning Assumptions). Lead ad hoc requests from Senior Management and cross-functional projects - You will also support the Finance Perspectives program, and partner with HR to provide coaching to the participants, support them on designing future rotations and career plans, as well as building the future talent pipeline
Who you are
You are someone who wants to influence your own development. You are looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies, and where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.
You will have a minimum of 3-5 years of professional experience in planning/finance / and/or consulting within the medical/pharmaceutical or scientific industries. MBA, CFA or PhD degree preferred.
We are looking for the following qualifications:
- Well-developed strategic and analytical mindset with a track record of integrating and synthesizing findings from multiple sources to enable informed strategic decision making - Ideally, a good knowledge base of our solutions and product offerings for patients, and experience with leading cross-functional projects and teams - Excellent oral communication/presentation skills to senior management and advanced skills with PowerPoint - Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work as part of a cross-functional team with a proven ability to inspire and ensure alignment between different senior stakeholders - Capable of seeing and formulating high-level insights and messages while also becoming familiar with the necessary details and facts to ensure quality
If this resonates with you and you want to shape your future with us: We are looking forward to receiving your application!
If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Finance, Finance > General Finance

That is why we come to work every single day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigor, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.

We are proud of who we are, what we do, and how we do it. We are many, working as one across functions, across companies, and across the world.

In this high-profile position, you will lead the annual Group Business Plan (BP) process in close collaboration with your Group Planning and Special Projects (FXE) colleagues and the broader planning network across the Roche Group. The BP includes the latest strategic and financial plans of the group and seeks to provide value-adding insights and opportunities to support Senior Management in their discussions and decision-making regarding the outlook of Roche. Further, you will be responsible for a set of corporate performance indicators that are used in the annual report and executive compensation.

Your main responsibilities include:

  • Lead the annual Group Business Plan (10-year plan) and Mid-Term Outlook (3- year plan) process
  • Play an active role in the planning squads and networks across the Roche Group. Identify ideas and innovative approaches to optimize the planning process
  • Provide insight, analysis, and recommendations to be used as part of planning discussions to improve decision making. Interact with business functions to understand long term strategies and drivers of performance and how they impact the overall Group picture
  • Present the Business Plan to selected functions and leadership teams to enable dissemination of insights into the Roche organisation
  • Responsible for specific corporate KPIs (e.g. TSR, Group Planning Assumptions). Lead ad hoc requests from Senior Management and cross-functional projects
  • You will also support the Finance Perspectives program, and partner with HR to provide coaching to the participants, support them on designing future rotations and career plans, as well as building the future talent pipeline

Who you are

You are someone who wants to influence your own development. You are looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies, and where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.

You will have a minimum of 3-5 years of professional experience in planning/finance / and/or consulting within the medical/pharmaceutical or scientific industries. MBA, CFA or PhD degree preferred.

We are looking for the following qualifications:

  • Well-developed strategic and analytical mindset with a track record of integrating and synthesizing findings from multiple sources to enable informed strategic decision making
  • Ideally, a good knowledge base of our solutions and product offerings for patients, and experience with leading cross-functional projects and teams
  • Excellent oral communication/presentation skills to senior management and advanced skills with PowerPoint
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work as part of a cross-functional team with a proven ability to inspire and ensure alignment between different senior stakeholders
  • Capable of seeing and formulating high-level insights and messages while also becoming familiar with the necessary details and facts to ensure quality

If this resonates with you and you want to shape your future with us: We are looking forward to receiving your application!

If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq

Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

Finance, Finance > General Finance

job.title: Transformation Lead, Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED)
job.plaincontent:
The Transformation Lead will be responsible for driving and coordinating transformation across pRED. The Lead will create a framework and associated architecture and implementation/change plan to make progress on the ambitions of pRED transformation in the coming years. They will create and lead a network of transformation multipliers across pRED to deliver on the overall transformation that goes beyond departmental boundaries, focused on impact, synergies and simplification.
Working together with senior leaders in pRED and the broader organization, this Lead, together with a broad network, will shift pRED’s culture towards one that enables the organization to be the most effective R&D organizations in industry, and where every employee can make meaningful progress to bring breakthrough solutions for patients every day.
Champion the vision, design and philosophy of transformation as outlined by the pLT.
The Transformation Lead will establish the architecture that will set the direction for pRED transformation roadmap, using existing Roche tools and programmes and applying this for pRED.
Build on the previously developed pRED Change Framework, integrate the findings of the recently completed pRED 2030 culture project and provide recommendations to key ongoing or planned culture and New Ways of Working (NWW) projects within pRED
Bring focus to pRED’s key transformation activities that enable the organisation to make significant progress on the goals and ambitions.
Approach implementation with an agile mindset, prioritize where to focus finite organizational energy, and deliver, test and adjust priorities and design
Identify barriers and drivers, plan, deploy resources, develop and drive tactics across pRED
Catalyze senior leadership and others to create and implement towards the future state . Act as mirror and coach across pRED, including as a partner to the senior leaders in pRED. Keep science, patients and R&D productivity front and center for the organization.
Experiment with and model new ways of working. Model the future state “agile” way of working. Create a small flexibly resourced team with strong enabling and collaborative interfaces to pRED Functions and Business Partners.
Explore and help implement and share best practices/recommendations around tools that support transformation and NWW.
Partner with transformation leads across Roche to explore synergies and connect worldwide transformations in a way that supports the success of the whole.
- Experience of leading, or having a significant role in, the implementation of large scale, multi-site/multi-country transformation & organizational change - Extremely strong interpersonal skills, with proven ability to challenge and influence at all levels in various organizations, both locally and globally - Be able to bring about change by engaging both hearts and minds of people - Proven ability to deliver solutions through networks or communities of experts - Demonstrated ability to apply conceptual and systems thinking; analytical thinking & problem solving approaches to complex challenges - Qualified in and experience of using Agile or Lean methodologies - Persuasive written and verbal communication skills, easily communicating complex ideas
Key Competency Profile:
- Systems Thinker: able to see connections and patterns, synthesize and distill complex topics and weigh tradeoffs - Courageous Authenticity: confident offering candor. Comfortable operating in ambiguity. Able to spark the team and others across the organization to pursue the ‘north star’ of the transformation - Decisive & Achieves Results: focused on progress and delivery. Persistent in support and guidance of the team and others through the ups and downs of organization change - Relating: builds strong collaborative networks and fosters teamplay - Composure: stays connected to the organization, yet calm and disciplined, functionally agnostic and progress-oriented
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Human Resources, Human Resources > Leadership & Organizational Development

job.title: Global Business Process Manager R2R Management Accounting
job.plaincontent:
As the Global Business Process Manager R2R for Management Accounting, you are part of the Roche Services & Solutions (RSS) BPM R2R organization and report to the Global Business Process Owner Record to Report.
In this role, you will be:
- Responsible for implementing the E2E BPM strategy - Accountable for global, cross divisional state-of-the-art process design for your business process area Management Accounting within the E2E process Record to Report - Empowered decision maker for your area across divisions and in line with the E2E Business Process Management guardrails from the GBPO - Working closely with the E2E GBPM & GBPS network to ensure fit-for-purpose solutions - Coaching the Global Business Process Specialists in- and outside the E2E network
Who you are:
- You have a degree in Finance, Business Administration, Informatics, Engineering or a comparable education - 7-10 years professional experience, preferably in Business Process Management and General Accounting & Controlling - Leadership experience, in a line and/or matrix function teams
You also bring the following skills and competencies:
- Expert for the specific area of the E2E business process including deep process knowledge and technical expertise - Strong technical competencies in IFRS Accounting, SAP FI/CO - Good methodological skills e.g. BPM, Six Sigma (DMAIC), agile ways of working (Scrum), continuous improvement (Lean, PDCA, Kaizen). - Agile mindset (speed, stability, flexibility) - works according to and brings in the agile mindset concept in daily operations) - Excellent management and coaching skills with experience in managing multicultural teams, strong organizational and project/change management skills, especially in matrix structures, considering/balancing interests of senior stakeholders from different functions. - Business fluency in English - Willingness to travel internationally up to 25%
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Manufacturing, Manufacturing > Operational Excellence

  • Leadership experience, in a line and/or matrix function teams

You also bring the following skills and competencies:

  • Expert for the specific area of the E2E business process including deep process knowledge and technical expertise

  • Good methodological skills e.g. BPM, Six Sigma (DMAIC), agile ways of working (Scrum), continuous improvement (Lean, PDCA, Kaizen).

job.title: (Associate) Group Director Real World Data Oncology
job.plaincontent:
As a (Associate)/Group Director within our Personalized HealthCare function you will be responsible for the data science strategies, and lead a team of Data Scientists using meaningful data to generate impactful evidence and insights on our molecules/ medicines and patients that support R&D, advance scientific and medical knowledge, and enable personalized patient care and access. The data will be varied in type -- patient-level clinical data, supplemented with deep patient data like omics (e.g. genomics, proteomic), imaging, digital health, etc. Source data will be diverse -- real-world data, including patient registries, electronic medical records, claims, biobanks, and clinical trials. The data science solutions will address molecule and disease area questions that will inform the research and development of our molecules, and support healthcare decisions by patients, physicians, health authorities, payers, and policy-makers. As a leader of the organization, you will also lead or contribute significantly to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external initiatives that shape our business and healthcare environments. This will require a deep understanding of molecule and disease area strategies, our business, healthcare environments, as well as excellent scientific and technical data science expertise. You will need excellent strategic, leadership, collaboration and communication skills, as well as an entrepreneurial mindset, to work with and through others, to transform the way we use data and analytics to develop and deliver medicines for our patients and to achieve the business objectives.
Full strategic accountability, includes setting and implementation responsibility for an assigned area. Typically responsible for leading a group of mid to senior level Data Scientists for one or more sub-functional areas. May manage one or more Associate Group Directors.
RESPONSIBILITIES
PHC Data Science (Associate) Group Director
- DEVELOP & DRIVE DATA STRATEGIES : Develop and drive overarching data science strategies, in collaboration with internal partners, to support research and development of our molecules and enable personalized patient care and access. - DELIVER PORTFOLIO AND BUSINESS: Resource molecule and disease area teams and initiatives effectively with internal and outsourced capabilities to deliver high quality, rigorous and fit-for-purpose data science solutions according to company priorities and opportunities to impact business. - SHAPE INTERNAL & EXTERNAL ENVIRONMENT: Lead or contribute significantly to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external data science communities, networks, collaborations, initiatives or goals on knowledge-sharing, methodologies, innovations, technology, IT infrastructure, policy-shaping, etc. to enable broader and more effective use of data and analytics to support business. - BUILD INTERNAL CAPABILITIES : Hire staff with appropriate skills, experience and potential, and cultivate an environment that attracts and retains talents. Ensure adequate training of our staff, provide business context and connection of our work with company priorities and values, inspire our staff to set high-standard goals and objectives and support them to achieve them. - ACQUIRE EXTERNAL CAPABILITIES: Collaborate with internal partners in due-diligence to assess and acquire/ collaborate with external capabilities in data, analytics, technology, etc. of strategic business fit to the business. - INNOVATE OUR FUNCTION: Define functional objectives and strategy, identify opportunities, gaps and priorities, and contribute to best practice standards. Stay abreast of emergent applications, methodologies, technologies, and external guidelines, and implement change to positively evolve the function’s capabilities and impacts. - FOSTER OUR CULTURE: Develop strong internal partnerships to promote effective collaborations. Lead by example in promoting a collaborative and entrepreneurial culture and a global mindset. Be an agent for change and engage support for innovative ideas and solutions.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
PHC Data Science (Associate) Group Director
- MSc, PhD, MD or similar qualification in a quantitative data science discipline (e.g., statistics / biostatistics, epidemiology, bioinformatics, health economics, computational biology, computer science, mathematics, outcomes research, public health, biology, medicine, psychology) - Demonstrated track record of leading and execution of data science research projects, including publications - Demonstrated track record of patient-level data analyses (e.g., real world data, surveys, clinical trials, registries, claims, omics or imaging data)
- Excellent communication skills. Proven ability to translate and communicate complex ideas, concepts, and data science solutions to diverse audiences - Proven ability to think strategically and successfully implement new strategies and ideas
- Excellent collaboration and leadership skills. Ability to motivate and inspire teams and manage change - Proficiency in English, both written and verbal
- Please note that depending on your experience and qualifications, we may offer one of these titles: Associate Group Director/Group Director.
- For Group Director we are looking for a professional with significant relevant leadership experience with track record of effectively building, leading and managing data scientists in a global environment.
PREFERRED/ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS
- PhD degree in a quantitative or health sciences discipline as listed in Minimum Qualifications - Therapeutic area expertise and drug development experience in Oncology - Subject matter expert of R&D, regulatory and/or health care systems use of real world evidence for decision-making
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Research & Development, Research & Development > Biometrics

  • Therapeutic area expertise and drug development experience in Oncology
  • Subject matter expert of R&D, regulatory and/or health care systems use of real world evidence for decision-making

job.title: un/e technicien/ne service après-vente
job.plaincontent:
La société Régent Appareils d’éclairage SA, dont le siège est à Bâle, emploie actuellement quelque 600 collaborateurs dans six pays. Leader du marché suisse, elle compte également parmi les principaux fabricants de luminaires en Europe et jouit d’une présence internationale grâce à ses partenaires de distribution dans 35 Pays. Nous recherchons pour notre succursale du Mont-sur-Lausanne
un/e technicien/ne service après-vente
VOS DÉFIS
- Dépannage et mise en service de nos produits - Montage, réparation et suivi de la lustrerie - Créer et suivre les dossiers dans notre système informatique - Contact avec notre clientèle professionnelle
VOS COMPÉTENCES
- CFC d’installateur-électricien ou équivalent - Quelques années d’expérience dans un domaine technique ou électrique - Goût pour le contact - Le sens des responsabilités - Capacité de travailler de manière indépendante, flexible et précise - Bonne maîtrise de l’informatique (MS Office), éventuellement MS Dynamics AX (Axapta) - Permis de conduire indispensable
NOUS VOUS OFFRONS
- Une entreprise innovante dans un environnement dynamique - Tradition vivante associée à des valeurs telles qu’une qualité irréprochable et une connaissance approfondie - Un large éventail de possibilités de formations auprès de notre Regent Lighting ACADEMY
Les personnes intéressées sont priées de transmettre leur offre avec CV à Régent Appareils d’éclairage SA, à l’att. de
Monsieur Daniel Levy Chemin du Rionzi 60 1052 Le Mont-sur-Lausanne
Tél. +41 21 642 02 22 / Fax +41 21 648 21 19 / Mail d.levy@regent.ch Postuler en ligne

job.title: Senior IAM Business Analyst 80-100 %
job.plaincontent:
Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten.
Wenn du wissen möchtest, warum Stabilität uns so beweglich, Erfahrung uns so offen für Neues und Empathie uns so erfolgreich macht, bewirb dich auf die Stelle
Senior IAM Business Analyst
Zürich|80-100 %|Referenz 1997
In this role you are part of the Identity & Access Management (IAM) team. As an IAM Business Analyst / Role Engineer, you will be responsible for IAM Governance, Role Management, Role Mining, Business- as well as Requirements-Analysis and Process Management capabilities within the IAM team. You will interact and work closely with different development teams, IT experts, business representatives and business analysts as well as other relevant stakeholders. Further, you resolve incidents and problems related to IAM services and provide support and consultation to the respective stakeholders in the IAM area. For the further development of this strategic focus topic, we are looking for a personality with a distinct delivery attitude.
What You Will Do
- Analyse, enhance and improve existing IAM regulations and processes - Ensure compliance with the risk and control framework and the audit requirements - Support the IAM team during compliance and audit activities - Engage with business and IT stakeholders to understand IAM requirements for new solutions and identify improvement opportunities - Participate in projects and act as single point of contact in selected areas and/or business units - Take SIX's IAM discipline to the next level of maturity by contributing and participating directly to its strategic projects and initiatives
What You Bring
- Good expertise in the Identity and Access Management area, best practices, processes and regulatory controls - Expert knowledge of IAM access control concepts (e.g. RBAC, ABAC, PBAC) - Proven experience and ability to work effectively with internal/external auditors - Practical experience in requirements gathering and process management / design - Excellent presentation skills in spoken and written English and German
Das bieten wir dir
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle Wir vertrauen unseren Mitarbeitenden, daher kannst du deine Home Office- und Anwesenheitszeiten im Team flexibel vereinbaren.
Persönliche Entwicklungsprogramme In regelmässigen Abständen kannst du an Trainings, Inhouse-Schulungen, Seminaren der SIX Academy, Mentoring oder Coachings teilnehmen.
Agile Arbeitsmethoden Egal ob Scrum oder Design Thinking spannende Aufgaben lösen wir gemeinsam in Teams
If you have any questions, please call Malene Baadsgaard Mikkelsen +41 58 399 2991.
For this vacancy we only accept direct applications.
Diversität ist uns wichtig, daher freuen wir uns über Bewerbungen unabhängig vom persönlichen Hintergrund.
Bewerben
Du möchtest mehr wissen?
Wir erzählen dir persönlich, wie wir unsere besten Seiten kombinieren und was das für deine Zukunft bei SIX bedeutet.
Discover SIX

In this role you are part of the Identity & Access Management (IAM) team. As an IAM Business Analyst / Role Engineer, you will be responsible for IAM Governance, Role Management, Role Mining, Business- as well as Requirements-Analysis and Process Management capabilities within the IAM team. You will interact and work closely with different development teams, IT experts, business representatives and business analysts as well as other relevant stakeholders. Further, you resolve incidents and problems related to IAM services and provide support and consultation to the respective stakeholders in the IAM area. For the further development of this strategic focus topic, we are looking for a personality with a distinct delivery attitude.

What You Will Do
  • Analyse, enhance and improve existing IAM regulations and processes
  • Ensure compliance with the risk and control framework and the audit requirements
  • Support the IAM team during compliance and audit activities
  • Engage with business and IT stakeholders to understand IAM requirements for new solutions and identify improvement opportunities
  • Participate in projects and act as single point of contact in selected areas and/or business units
  • Take SIX's IAM discipline to the next level of maturity by contributing and participating directly to its strategic projects and initiatives
What You Bring
  • Good expertise in the Identity and Access Management area, best practices, processes and regulatory controls
  • Expert knowledge of IAM access control concepts (e.g. RBAC, ABAC, PBAC)
  • Proven experience and ability to work effectively with internal/external auditors
  • Practical experience in requirements gathering and process management / design
  • Excellent presentation skills in spoken and written English and German

job.title: Head of IT, Content Production 100%
job.plaincontent:
Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten.
Wenn du wissen möchtest, warum Stabilität uns so beweglich, Erfahrung uns so offen für Neues und Empathie uns so erfolgreich macht, bewirb dich auf die Stelle
Head of IT, Content Production
Zürich|100%|Referenz 2134
At the heart of the Financial Information business, the Content Production team is responsible for delivering and operating our mission critical central platform and services that consolidate data from hundreds of sources, in a reliable, timely and qualitative way. The Head of Content Production will also play a key role in supporting the business and IT teams in charge of the downstream systems and services that are entering into a massive transformation. Beyond the required daily operational excellence and the continuous research for better efficiency, the Head of Content Production will then contribute to the design and delivery of the new capabilities that will enable the transformation of our operating model. The organization follows an Agile methodology (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban) and is organized as a series of DevOps teams.
What You Will Do
- Overall responsibility for the delivery and the run of all Content Production applications and services - Leadership responsibility of around 80 DevOps employees of the Content Production team - Manage the Content Production IT budget - Ensure alignment of the team priorities and staff allocation with the business project portfolio and strategy - Ensure seamless integration and interoperability of Content Production services with the downstream Financial Information services - Ensure architecture and technology alignment with SIX enterprise architecture and Financial Information target architecture - Implement IT projects, including with potential 3rd party sourcing - Maintain service and operational excellence, according to Financial Information SLAs - Manage IT processes, tools, best practices and compliance in line with regulations and SIX IT Governance
What You Bring
- Education: Master's degree in computer science or similar - 10 years of experience in similar positions in global IT organizations, ideally in the Financial Services industry, with 2+ level management - Tech-savvy, able to drive innovation and to implement state of the art technology, especially in the Big Data, Machine Learning and Cloud Computing fields - Familiar with Agile and DevOps methodology - Leadership skills, entrepreneurial mindset, high degree of integrity and forethought in his/her approach to making decisions - Analytical, structured and able to transform organizations as well as act as a change agent in a fast-evolving environments - Ability to create strong and extended networks across diverse teams, functions and cultures, with high EQ and SQ - Excellent listening, negotiation and communication skills, including at C-level - Passionate by customer satisfaction and demonstrating service-oriented mindset - Excellent verbal and written skills in English; French and German appreciated
Das bieten wir dir
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle Wir vertrauen unseren Mitarbeitenden, daher kannst du deine Home Office- und Anwesenheitszeiten im Team flexibel vereinbaren.
Persönliche Entwicklungsprogramme In regelmässigen Abständen kannst du an Trainings, Inhouse-Schulungen, Seminaren der SIX Academy, Mentoring oder Coachings teilnehmen.
Agile Arbeitsmethoden Egal ob Scrum oder Design Thinking spannende Aufgaben lösen wir gemeinsam in Teams
If you have any questions, please call Melanie Kurath +41 58 399 31 80.
For this vacancy we only accept direct applications.
Diversität ist uns wichtig, daher freuen wir uns über Bewerbungen unabhängig vom persönlichen Hintergrund.

job.title: Cyber Security Engineer (Platforms) 80-100%
job.plaincontent:
Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten.
Wenn du wissen möchtest, warum Stabilität uns so beweglich, Erfahrung uns so offen für Neues und Empathie uns so erfolgreich macht, bewirb dich auf die Stelle
Cyber Security Engineer (Platforms)
Zürich|80-100%|Referenz 2149
Wir suchen dich! Dank dir kann der schweizer Finanzplatz weiterhin ohne Probleme seine Dienstleistungen erbringen. Dein Arbeitsplatz liegt im urbanen Zürich West, wo du von einer ausgezeichneten Infrastruktur profitieren kannst. Als Teil des Security Platform Services Teams unterstützt du mit dem Betrieb verschiedener Tools die IT Security wie auch die operative Stabilität der gesamten IT Infrastruktur. Diese Tools wirst du in Zusammenarbeit mit internen Kollegen massgeblich weiterentwickeln und für die Zukunft fit machen. Deine Arbeit unterstützt unser Cyber-Security-Program womit du gleichzeitig immer auf dem neusten Stand der Industrieentwicklung bist. Unser grosszügiges und vielfältiges Angebot an Weiterbildungen wird dich dabei perfekt begleiten.
Das sind deine Aufgaben
- Du betreibst, planst und installierst Platform Security Tools - Du verfeinerst und optimierst Platform Security Tools - Du bringst dein fundiertes technisches Produkt-Know-how ein, um Kollegen zu beraten - Du bringst dein Wissen als Security Engineer in das Cyber-Security-Program ein und hilfst, unsere Security Platformen kontinuierlich zu verbessern - Du berätst Application und Platform Owner bei der Anbindung und Automatisierung von Datenquellen und unterstützen sie während des gesamten Lebenszyklus
Das bringst du mit
- Du bist als Ingenieur, von der sich ständig verändernden Cyber-Security Landschaft fasziniert - Du verfügst über mehrere Jahre Erfahrung im Betrieb von Security Platformen (z.B. Vulnerability Mgmt, Security Base Line Monitoring, File Integrity Monitoring, Compliance Monitoring mit Tools wie Splunk, Tripwire etc.) - Du identifizierst dich mit einer starken Kundenorientierung - Du freust dich dein Domänenwissen stetig zu erweitern und an den Herausforderungen in Projekten zu wachsen - Du bist motiviert, dir laufend neue Fähigkeiten anzueignen und geniesst die hervorragende Unterstützung der SIX bei Ausbildungen und Zertifizierungen - Deine ausgezeichneten Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch runden dein Profil ab und ermöglichen dir den Austausch mit deinen Kolleginnen und Kollegen in der Schweiz und im Ausland
Das bieten wir dir
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle Wir vertrauen unseren Mitarbeitenden, daher kannst du deine Home Office- und Anwesenheitszeiten im Team flexibel vereinbaren.
Persönliche Entwicklungsprogramme In regelmässigen Abständen kannst du an Trainings, Inhouse-Schulungen, Seminaren der SIX Academy, Mentoring oder Coachings teilnehmen.
Agile Arbeitsmethoden Egal ob Scrum oder Design Thinking spannende Aufgaben lösen wir gemeinsam in Teams
Bei Fragen steht dir Sebastian Unger zur Verfügung.

job.title: System Engineer 80-100%
job.plaincontent:
Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten.
Wenn du wissen möchtest, warum Stabilität uns so beweglich, Erfahrung uns so offen für Neues und Empathie uns so erfolgreich macht, bewirb dich auf die Stelle
System Engineer
Zürich|80-100%|Referenz 2155
In this senior position you play a key role in the build and operation of a new critical services team. While performing within this highly skilled team, you contribute in project work, join forces with the business as well as corporate security, application- and platform owners. The team is responsible for design, deployment, security and management of critical services like Active Directory, Public Key Infrastructure, Identity Federation and Multi-factor Authentication.
You are highly motivated to bring in your qualities, shape this new multicultural and diversity team as an integral part and you are ready to tackle the challenges of critical services in the Swiss Financial Industry. SIX is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a high-reaching advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.
What You Will Do
- you have the role of a subject matter expert, being responsible of the design, i.e. implement and develop directory services by also supporting our technical experts while building up your own expertise - furthermore, you are applying analytical, technical and business skills to resolve operational issues such as automation and improvements, develop design concepts and addressing findings for the team Security Engineer - you will become step by step the specialist on topics of your choice in this field of expertise by showing initiative, including supporting and drive the implementation of business projects and requirements in line with the Blueprints - putting together the documentations and from time to time on-call service
What You Bring
- a graduate degree in Computer Science Information Technology or an equivalent education with at least 5 years' experience in System Engineering preferably in the Financial Services sector or equivalent business area - you are a self-starter with a positive hands-on attitude and good communication & stakeholder management skills to drive all aspects of System Engineering and you are a pro-active personality with a strong drive to enter the world of identity provider technology - attention to detail and the ability, initiative and openness to cooperate in a technical team and interact with other business units - first knowledge of Active Directory and Active Directory Federation Services would be an advantage - very good command in English (verbal and writing) and preferably as well in German
Das bieten wir dir
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle Wir vertrauen unseren Mitarbeitenden, daher kannst du deine Home Office- und Anwesenheitszeiten im Team flexibel vereinbaren.
Persönliche Entwicklungsprogramme In regelmässigen Abständen kannst du an Trainings, Inhouse-Schulungen, Seminaren der SIX Academy, Mentoring oder Coachings teilnehmen.
Agile Arbeitsmethoden Egal ob Scrum oder Design Thinking spannende Aufgaben lösen wir gemeinsam in Teams

  • you will become step by step the specialist on topics of your choice in this field of expertise by showing initiative, including supporting and drive the implementation of business projects and requirements in line with the Blueprints
  • putting together the documentations and from time to time on-call service
 
  What You Bring
  • a graduate degree in Computer Science Information Technology or an equivalent education with at least 5 years' experience in System Engineering preferably in the Financial Services sector or equivalent business area
  • you are a self-starter with a positive hands-on attitude and good communication & stakeholder management skills to drive all aspects of System Engineering and you are a pro-active personality with a strong drive to enter the world of identity provider technology
  • attention to detail and the ability, initiative and openness to cooperate in a technical team and interact with other business units
  • first knowledge of Active Directory and Active Directory Federation Services would be an advantage 
  • very good command in English (verbal and writing) and preferably as well in German 

Das bieten wir dir

Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle
Wir vertrauen unseren Mitarbeitenden, daher kannst du deine Home Office- und Anwesenheitszeiten im Team flexibel vereinbaren.

Persönliche Entwicklungsprogramme

Agile Arbeitsmethoden 
Egal ob Scrum oder Design Thinking spannende Aufgaben lösen wir gemeinsam in Teams

For this vacancy we only accept direct applications.

job.plaincontent:
Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten.

Skype for Business & Cloud Services Engineer
Zürich|80-100 %|Referenz 2122
Unser Communication Engineering Team arbeitet im Engineering/Operation Ansatz und zeichnet sich verantwortlich für den Betrieb, die Optimierung und die kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung zahlreicher Corporate Services wie Telefonie, E-Mail und File-Services. Zur Unterstützung unseres Teams suchen wir eine motivierte Person mit Erfahrung im Bereich Microsoft Skype for Business, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft365 sowie Cloud- und File Services. Erfahrung mit Security und Compliance Themen in diesen Bereichen rundet dein Profil ab. Bist du bereit, dich den zahlreichen Herausforderungen im Umfeld des Schweizer Finanzplatzes zu stellen?
Das sind deine Aufgaben
- Betrieb und Weiterentwicklung unserer Microsoft Skype for Business- / Microsoft Teams / Exchange Services - Integration neuer Applikationen / Services in die bestehende Umgebung - Zusammenarbeit und Koordination mit unseren verschiedenen Business Units und internationalen Kollegen - Mitarbeit bei Audits und Security-Engineering sowie Unterhalt der Systemdokumentation - Pikettdienst ist für unsere Services notwendig
Das bringst du mit
- Sehr gutes Microsoft Skype for Business und Microsoft Teams Know-how - Gute Cloud- und Files-Services Know-how - Wenn du, zudem Microsoft Exchange, Mail Gateway, Microsoft365 oder Exchange Online Know-how mitbringst, passt du perfekt ins Team - Initiative, offene und teamorientierte Persönlichkeit, Interesse an Security Themen im IT-Umfeld - Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Das bieten wir dir
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle Wir vertrauen unseren Mitarbeitenden, daher kannst du deine Home Office- und Anwesenheitszeiten im Team flexibel vereinbaren.

job.title: Senior Software Enigneer 80 - 100%
job.plaincontent:
Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten.
Wenn du wissen möchtest, warum Stabilität uns so beweglich, Erfahrung uns so offen für Neues und Empathie uns so erfolgreich macht, bewirb dich auf die Stelle
Senior Software Enigneer
Zürich|80 - 100%|Referenz 2164
Are you ready to work @ SIX? You want code? Turn the impossible into reality? Square the circle? Yes? But this is not all this job offers.
We need your engineering skills and passion for designing and implementing new features in our software which offer a strong user experience to our clients. You deliver and display an amazing amount of data in high-quality applications based on modern technologies. You are the talented genius behind our programs! Our dynamic team consist of more than 15 multicultural members and we work in a DevOps setup together since close to three years in the Financial Information area.
What You Will Do
- you are a Senior Software Engineer and coding is fun! But you are aware there is more than coding - like requirements engineering, solution design, testing, etc. - learning from other smart team members and sharing experiences is just normal for you - writing user stories and test cases, working transparently, giving and taking feedback is a way of working in which you feel comfortable - you are DevOps, i.e. it is not just a buzzword, it is your attitude. Taking over responsibility, challenging the status quo, eliminating waste, bringing in new ideas and solutions is your passion.
What You Bring
- a well-founded IT educated personality with passion for the whole software lifecycle including willingness to be sometimes on call services (remotely) - profound knowledge of Java with a minimum of 7-8 years of experience. With a focus on technologies such NoSql, Elastic Search, Jenkins, Docker - positive, initiative and result-driven attitude with high sense for quality - communicative, team-oriented and resilient personality - good level of English (verbal and writing), German is a plus but not mandatory
Das bieten wir dir
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle Wir vertrauen unseren Mitarbeitenden, daher kannst du deine Home Office- und Anwesenheitszeiten im Team flexibel vereinbaren.
Persönliche Entwicklungsprogramme In regelmässigen Abständen kannst du an Trainings, Inhouse-Schulungen, Seminaren der SIX Academy, Mentoring oder Coachings teilnehmen.
Agile Arbeitsmethoden Egal ob Scrum oder Design Thinking spannende Aufgaben lösen wir gemeinsam in Teams
If you have any questions, please call Corinne Schmuki +41 58 399 3365.
For this vacancy we only accept direct applications.
Diversität ist uns wichtig, daher freuen wir uns über Bewerbungen unabhängig vom persönlichen Hintergrund.

job.title: Solution Developer 80-100
job.plaincontent:
Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten.
Wenn du wissen möchtest, warum Stabilität uns so beweglich, Erfahrung uns so offen für Neues und Empathie uns so erfolgreich macht, bewirb dich auf die Stelle
Solution Developer
Zürich|80-100|Referenz 2185
The Competence Center Corporate Business Solutions is responsible for the operation, optimization and continuous development of all corporate services and applications. Cross-functional collaboration and agile principles provide end-to-end services with a high focus on customer satisfaction. As an IT Solution Developer with proven experience and high motivation, you are able to work along various areas of business and IT requirements with a strong focus on the implementation of localization services within surrounding applications and platforms. Additionally, you should lead the further development and optimization of the used solution and environment. Furthermore, you are responsible for designing, implementing, managing and testing of the Localization as a Service (LaaS) to meet the Business and IT stakeholder requirements and security guidelines.
You are highly motivated to bring in your qualities, shape this new multicultural and diversity team as an integral part and you are ready to tackle the challenges of professional services in the Swiss Financial Industry. SIX is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a high-reaching advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.
What You Will Do
- enable and provide technical advice towards the integration and on-boarding of Business Applications and Services onto the Multifactor Authentication (MFA) Solution providing user location via a smart device - professionally support and liaise with cross-functional teams to identify, define, recommend and achieve IT and Business objectives in the areas of Authentication and Localization - contribute and ensure a proactive development of authentication and security/privacy features within the existing solution and permanently discovering new ones - conduct and provide in-depth technical reviews to continuously monitor and improve the quality of the Enterprise Localization Service to determine the state of operation - be part of a 5x24 support organization for LaaS and the related service Encryption as a Service (EaaS) to ensure an ongoing service quality and availability
What You Bring
- IT Bachelor's or Master's degree or higher education in a related field or equivalent and several years of work experience as Solution Developer or System Engineer/Senior Consultant for Data Security and Authentication solutions - strong understanding of creating and using web service technologies as well as programming and scripting skills with different languages/technologies (Java, Java Script, Python, PowerShell, Linux) - familiar with security standards (SSL/TLS, HTTP, Cookie Handling, STS, OAuth, SAML, WS-Security & WS Trust) and cloud (private, public or hybrid) security concepts and technologies - experience with container platforms, linux operating systems (eg. CentOS) and web servers (Apache, IIS) - excellent verbal and written skills in English. German language skills are an advantage.
Das bieten wir dir
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle Wir vertrauen unseren Mitarbeitenden, daher kannst du deine Home Office- und Anwesenheitszeiten im Team flexibel vereinbaren.
Persönliche Entwicklungsprogramme In regelmässigen Abständen kannst du an Trainings, Inhouse-Schulungen, Seminaren der SIX Academy, Mentoring oder Coachings teilnehmen.
Agile Arbeitsmethoden Egal ob Scrum oder Design Thinking spannende Aufgaben lösen wir gemeinsam in Teams
If you have any questions, please call Corinne Schmuki +41 58 399 3365.
For this vacancy we only accept direct applications.
Diversität ist uns wichtig, daher freuen wir uns über Bewerbungen unabhängig vom persönlichen Hintergrund.
Bewerben

Cloud Software Engineer
Zürich|80-100%|Referenz 2230
Do you want to work in an agile, self-organized environment where passion, trust and innovation are paramount? We are looking for an experienced software developer to help us move forward. You will be working in a diverse environment in close cooperation with various business units, and both internal and external customers.
What You Will Do
- As a a developer with your strong customer focus and technical skills, you build and challenge cloud service solutions - You will provide PaaS and Managed Services with your strong "automate everything" mindset - You ensure technical integration of shared services and surrounding systems - Drive technical ideas and initiatives forward so that our cross functional cloud team can effectively and efficiently build and operate services - With your analytical thinking and your ability to grasp issues fast, you are constantly working your way into new topics - As part of a cross functional team you will be end-to-end involved from design to development and operation
What You Bring
- Committed and able to work independently as well as a communicative and positive-thinking team player coupled with eagerness to learn and share his/her knowledge - You are having an in-depth knowledge of Agile process and software principles - Several years of experience in the area of private and public cloud service development that meet the highest availability, performance and security requirements - In-depth knowledge of and experience with at least one programming language (prefered Golang, Java, ...) - Experience with Webservices, API, REST - Excellent communication and presentation skills in English and German

job.title: Head Post Trading 80- 100 %
job.plaincontent:
Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten.
Wenn du wissen möchtest, warum Stabilität uns so beweglich, Erfahrung uns so offen für Neues und Empathie uns so erfolgreich macht, bewirb dich auf die Stelle
Head Post Trading
Zürich|80- 100 %|Referenz 1985
SIX Securities & Exchanges is looking for a Head Post Trading. In this position, she/he is in charge of managing and delivering systemically important Settlement und Custody infrastructure services for the Swiss financial center. The key objective is to increase efficiency and quality across the entire value chain and to effectively manage the Post Trading product portfolio. Post Trading has currently about 280 FTEs. The role Head Post Trading reports into the Head Securities & Exchanges and is part of the Management Committee of the business unit. It also acts as guarantor ensuring proper business contact to the regulators (FINMA).
What You Will Do
- Operate client-centric and requirements-driven post trade services for domestic and international clients, establish SIX as provider of choice - Deliver sustainable, yearly efficiency improvements in Post Trading - Expand business by establishing new services, aiming to improve range of services and/or economies of scale, actively manage Post Trading product portfolio and respective lifecycles, innovate in close cooperation with Business Development and Innovation & Digital - Follow through on change transformation incl. quality upgrade of the workforce and human capital management - Actively shape culture and strategy of Securities & Exchanges as a member of the Management Committee
What You Bring
- Long-standing industry track record and expertise in running post trade infrastructures for financial instruments in capital markets institutions or market infrastructure providers - Track record in operational excellence, regulatory compliance and ongoing efficiency enhancement - Several years of experience in comparable leadership position - Ability to successfully introduce new products / extend post trading platform scope - Profound knowledge of supporting technology and technological developments - A leader with entrepreneurial mindset who is viewed by others as having a high degree of integrity and forethought in his/her approach to making decisions - Excellent listening and communication skills - Excellent verbal and written skills in English and German
Das bieten wir dir

job.htmlcontent:
Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten.

Wenn du wissen möchtest, warum Stabilität uns so beweglich, Erfahrung uns so offen für Neues und Empathie uns so erfolgreich macht, bewirb dich auf die Stelle

Head Post Trading

Zürich|80- 100 %|Referenz 1985

SIX Securities & Exchanges is looking for a Head Post Trading. In this position, she/he is in charge of managing and delivering systemically important Settlement und Custody infrastructure services for the Swiss financial center. The key objective is to increase efficiency and quality across the entire value chain and to effectively manage the Post Trading product portfolio.
Post Trading has currently about 280 FTEs. The role Head Post Trading reports into the Head Securities & Exchanges and is part of the Management Committee of the business unit.  It also acts as guarantor ensuring proper business contact to the regulators (FINMA).

What You Will Do
  • Operate client-centric and requirements-driven post trade services for domestic and international clients, establish SIX as provider of choice
  • Deliver sustainable, yearly efficiency improvements in Post Trading
  • Expand business by establishing new services, aiming to improve range of services and/or economies of scale, actively manage Post Trading product portfolio and respective lifecycles, innovate in close cooperation with Business Development and Innovation & Digital
  • Follow through on change transformation incl. quality upgrade of the workforce and human capital management
  • Actively shape culture and strategy of Securities & Exchanges as a member of the Management Committee
  What You Bring
  • Long-standing industry track record and expertise in running post trade infrastructures for financial instruments in capital markets institutions or market infrastructure providers
  • Track record in operational excellence, regulatory compliance and ongoing efficiency enhancement
  • Several years of experience in comparable leadership position
  • Ability to successfully introduce new products / extend post trading platform scope
  • Profound knowledge of supporting technology and technological developments
  • A leader with entrepreneurial mindset who is viewed by others as having a high degree of integrity and forethought in his/her approach to making decisions
  • Excellent listening and communication skills
  • Excellent verbal and written skills in English and German

job.title: Head of Key Management 80-100%
job.plaincontent:
Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten.
Wenn du wissen möchtest, warum Stabilität uns so beweglich, Erfahrung uns so offen für Neues und Empathie uns so erfolgreich macht, bewirb dich auf die Stelle
Head of Key Management
Zürich|80-100%|Referenz 2214
You will be responsible for SDX key management, on both the development and operational side. As a 100% subsidiary of SIX, you are closely aligned with SIX Corporate Security, IT Platform and Risk Control.
What You Will Do
- Defining, running and optimising the SDX key management infrastructure (e.g., PKI, HSM) based on SIX policies, specifications and frameworks - Managing hardware related activities (e.g., HSM management and monitoring) - Support of customers in key management related tasks - PKI design and operations, as well as maintenance of processes, automation and governance - Ownership and general authority of the key management - Representing SDX in specialist/subject matter committees, working groups, internal and external organizations with regards to key management
What You Bring
- Practical work experience in IT risk and information security management together with detailed knowledge of enterprise PKI infrastructure design, operations and relevant cryptography - Excellent knowledge of IT infrastructure on-premises and in the cloud (Azure, O365), IT architecture, and information security. Knowledge of distributed ledger technology (e.g., blockchain) is an advantage - University degree or equivalent, preferably with a degree in information technology management information systems - Knowledge of the relevant laws and regulations of the financial industry, in particular stock exchanges (FinFraG, Banking Act, Stock Exchange Act, FINMA Circulars, IOSCO International Organisation of Securities Commissions etc.) is an advantage - Independent and structured way of working, quick comprehension, high self-initiative, practice-oriented and flexible - Very good communication skills with various target groups and management levels, within the company and with external customers and partners
Das bieten wir dir
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle Wir vertrauen unseren Mitarbeitenden, daher kannst du deine Home Office- und Anwesenheitszeiten im Team flexibel vereinbaren.

If you have any questions, please call Simon Clarke +44 7960 160 653.
For this vacancy we only accept direct applications.

job.title: Test Automation Engineer 80-100%
job.plaincontent:
Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten.
Wenn du wissen möchtest, warum Stabilität uns so beweglich, Erfahrung uns so offen für Neues und Empathie uns so erfolgreich macht, bewirb dich auf die Stelle
Test Automation Engineer
Zürich|80-100%|Referenz 1992
As a Test Automation Engineer you are part of the area Quality Assurance in IT at SIX. Our mission is to deliver outstanding quality for our internal clients and with this we continuously improve our quality functions in compliance with our business unit needs.
In this process you will ensure that the provided quality meets our clients' expectations – that the right things are executed and tested in the right way and in a timely manner along the entire supply chain. With your expertise in test automation you are able to contribute important impulses and provide your experiences to the team to enable competitive and forward-looking solutions in this area.
You are looking forward to providing the unique mix between business (economic) and technological understanding (comprehension) and the agility to be part of this vision.
What You Will Do
- Definition and implementation of the test automation strategy, including development of a test automation environment - Maintain and foster relationships to the business and technical stakeholders (i.e. Product Owners, Product-Managers, Software Developers) and being responsible for further development of agile testing as part of the test community - Performance of end-to-end testing activities from planning stage over functional specification (design) to final implementation - Coaching of team members in quality assurance, test strategy and testing methodology - Together with your team colleagues you enjoy to actively shape and design quality assurance and testing activities
What You Bring
- At least 2-3 years professional experience and considerable experience of working closely with Testing-, development teams and customer representatives - Expert knowledge in testing automation with frameworks for automated software tests, i.e. ideally you have an advanced training in software-/quality assurance (CARS, IREB, ISTQB) - You have programming expertise (Java, C++ or C# and SQL) in message driven architectures and brought skills in various test management as well as defect management tools (e.g. JIRA XRAY, HP ALM, UFT, Lean FT, TOSCA or Selenium) - Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English, German would be an advantage
Das bieten wir dir
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle Wir vertrauen unseren Mitarbeitenden, daher kannst du deine Home Office- und Anwesenheitszeiten im Team flexibel vereinbaren.
Persönliche Entwicklungsprogramme In regelmässigen Abständen kannst du an Trainings, Inhouse-Schulungen, Seminaren der SIX Academy, Mentoring oder Coachings teilnehmen.
Agile Arbeitsmethoden Egal ob Scrum oder Design Thinking spannende Aufgaben lösen wir gemeinsam in Teams
If you have any questions, please call Corinne Schmuki +41 58 399 3365.
For this vacancy we only accept direct applications.
Diversität ist uns wichtig, daher freuen wir uns über Bewerbungen unabhängig vom persönlichen Hintergrund.

Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten.

Wenn du wissen möchtest, warum Stabilität uns so beweglich, Erfahrung uns so offen für Neues und Empathie uns so erfolgreich macht, bewirb dich auf die Stelle

Test Automation Engineer

Zürich|80-100%|Referenz 1992

As a Test Automation Engineer you are part of the area Quality Assurance in IT at SIX.  Our mission is to deliver outstanding quality for our internal clients and with this we continuously improve our quality functions in compliance with our business unit needs.

In this process you will ensure that the provided quality meets our clients' expectations – that the right things are executed and tested in the right way and in a timely manner along the entire supply chain. With your expertise in test automation you are able to contribute important impulses and provide your experiences to the team to enable competitive and forward-looking solutions in this area.

You are looking forward to providing the unique mix between business (economic) and technological understanding (comprehension) and the agility to be part of this vision. 

What You Will Do
  • Definition and implementation of the test automation strategy, including development of a test automation environment
  • Maintain and foster relationships to the business and technical stakeholders (i.e. Product Owners, Product-Managers, Software Developers) and being responsible for further development of agile testing as part of the test community
  • Performance of end-to-end testing activities from planning stage over functional specification (design) to final implementation
  • Coaching of team members in quality assurance, test strategy and testing methodology
  • Together with your team colleagues you enjoy to actively shape and design quality assurance and testing activities 
What You Bring
  • At least 2-3 years professional experience and considerable experience of working closely with Testing-, development teams and customer representatives
  • Expert knowledge in testing automation with frameworks for automated software tests, i.e. ideally you have an advanced training in software-/quality assurance (CARS, IREB, ISTQB)
  • You have programming expertise (Java, C++ or C# and SQL) in message driven architectures and brought skills in various test management as well as defect management tools (e.g. JIRA XRAY, HP ALM, UFT, Lean FT, TOSCA or Selenium)
  • Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English, German would be an advantage

job.title: Servicetechniker oder Einbauer Haushaltgeräte
job.plaincontent:
SIBIRGroup AG, ein Unternehmen der V-ZUG AG, bietet von der Küche über den Waschraum bis hin zum Ofen ein breites Spektrum an Produkten und Allmarken-Services. Alles aus einer Hand und das flächendeckend in der ganzen Schweiz. Zur Verstärkung unserer Teams in der Deutschschweiz (Einsatzort abhängig vom Wohnort) suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung einen zuverlässigen, verantwortungsbewussten und selbst- ständigen
Servicetechniker oder Einbauer Haushaltgeräte
Ihre Hauptaufgaben:
- Reparieren, Installieren und Austauschen des Vollsortiments von Eigen- und Fremdmarken (Ser- vicetechniker) - Montieren und Austauschen des Vollsortiments von Eigen- und Fremdmarken (Einbauer) - Erstellen von Angeboten für Geräteersatz - Durchführen von Servicekontrollen bei Mieterwechsel - Erfassen der Dienstleistungen im elektronischen Rapportierungssystem - weitere Arbeiten auf Auftrag und Teilnahme an Produkteschulungen
Ihr Profl:
- abgeschlossene Ausbildung im Elektrobereich (Elektromonteur, Automatiker, Elektroniker, Poly- mechaniker, Automechaniker, o.Ä.) - elektrischer Anschlussbewilligung (NIV 15) - mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung, Branchenerfahrung von Vorteil - Freude am täglichen Umgang mit Kunden bei technischer- oder Verkaufsberatung - EDV-Kenntnisse und Führerausweis B
Nach einer gründlichen Einführung erwartet Sie eine interessante und selbständige Tätigkeit in einem professionellen Arbeitsumfeld. Zur Erledigung Ihrer Aufgaben stehen Ihnen ein voll ausgerüsteter Ser- vice-Wagen sowie ein moderner Tablet-PC zur Verfügung. Bringen Sie Ihre fachlichen und menschli- chen Qualitäten bei uns ein und profitieren Sie von unseren zeitgemässen Anstellungsbedingungen. Interessiert? Wir freuen uns auf Ihre elektronische oder schriftliche Bewerbung. SIBIRGroup AG, Bahnhofstrasse 134, 8957 Spreitenbach, Tel. 044 755 73 15, sandra.waldvogel@sibirgroup.ch, www.sibirgroup.ch

SIBIRGroup AG, ein Unternehmen der V-ZUG AG, bietet von der Küche über den Waschraum bis hin

Servicetechniker oder Einbauer Haushaltgeräte

  • Reparieren, Installieren und Austauschen des Vollsortiments von Eigen- und Fremdmarken (Ser-
    vicetechniker)
  • Montieren und Austauschen des Vollsortiments von Eigen- und Fremdmarken (Einbauer)
  • Erstellen von Angeboten für Geräteersatz
  • Durchführen von Servicekontrollen bei Mieterwechsel
  • Erfassen der Dienstleistungen im elektronischen Rapportierungssystem
  • weitere Arbeiten auf Auftrag und Teilnahme an Produkteschulungen

Ihr Profl:

  • abgeschlossene Ausbildung im Elektrobereich (Elektromonteur, Automatiker, Elektroniker, Poly-
    mechaniker, Automechaniker, o.Ä.)
  • elektrischer Anschlussbewilligung (NIV 15)
  • mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung, Branchenerfahrung von Vorteil
  • Freude am täglichen Umgang mit Kunden bei technischer- oder Verkaufsberatung
  • EDV-Kenntnisse und Führerausweis B

Nach einer gründlichen Einführung erwartet Sie eine interessante und selbständige Tätigkeit in einem
professionellen Arbeitsumfeld. Zur Erledigung Ihrer Aufgaben stehen Ihnen ein voll ausgerüsteter Ser-
vice-Wagen sowie ein moderner Tablet-PC zur Verfügung. Bringen Sie Ihre fachlichen und menschli-
chen Qualitäten bei uns ein und profitieren Sie von unseren zeitgemässen Anstellungsbedingungen.
Interessiert? Wir freuen uns auf Ihre elektronische oder schriftliche Bewerbung.
SIBIRGroup AG, Bahnhofstrasse 134, 8957 Spreitenbach, Tel. 044 755 73 15, sandra.waldvogel@sibirgroup.ch,
www.sibirgroup.ch

job.title: Projektmanager Development Services (w/m)
job.plaincontent:
Projektmanager Development
Services (w/m)
für den Standort Kirchberg, Kanton St. Gallen, Schweiz Mit einem geplanten Umsatz von über 750 Millionen Euro für das laufende Geschäftsjahr zählt die Aenova Group zu den weltweit führenden Unternehmen der Pharma- und Healthcare-Branche. Das Servicespektrum der Gruppe umfasst die gesamte Wertschöpfungskette der Entwicklung und Herstellung aller gängigen Darreichungsformen und Produktgruppen im Bereich Arznei- und Nahrungsergänzungsmittel. Mit hohen Qualitätsstandards, innovativen Technologien und einer klaren Zukunftsausrichtung hat sich Aenova zu Europas Marktführer im Business-to-Business entwickelt. Das Unternehmen mit Sitz bei München, ist mit 22 Standorten weltweit in zehn Ländern vertreten. Mehr als 4.300 Mitarbeiter tragen zum Erfolg der Unternehmensgruppe bei. Was erwartet Sie? Projektmanagement unserer Entwicklungs- und Transferprojekte von Weichgelatinekapseln Entwicklung von Weichgelatinekapseln und den dazu gehörigen Herstellungsprozessen inklusive Scale-up in den Produktionsmaßstab Formulierungsentwicklung von Weichgelatinekapseln für Arzneimittel Erstellen/Überwachen von Projektplänen mit Arbeitspaketen, Verantwortlichkeiten und Zeitachsen in Absprache mit dem Projektteam und dem Kunden Unterstützung der Kunden bei der Erstellung/Änderung von Zulassungsdossiers Erstellung von GMP-konformer Dokumentation wie MBRs (Master Batch Records) und Entwicklungsberichten Interne und externe Präsentation des Projektfortschritts Was sollten Sie mitbringen? Abgeschlossenes Naturwissenschaftliches Studium, vorzugsweise Pharmazie oder Pharmatechnik Promotion in Pharmazeutischer Technologie ein Plus Erfahrung in der Pharmaindustrie (Entwicklung/Produktion) wünschenswert Gute MS-Office-Kenntnisse; SAP-Kenntnisse von Vorteil Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Starke Zielorientierung, Flexibilität und hohe Einsatzbereitschaft Ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit Hands-on Mentalität Wir bieten ein wachstumsorientiertes, dynamisches und internationales Umfeld, in dem sich spannende standortu bergreifende Aufgaben, sowie aktive Mitgestaltungsmo glichkeiten bieten. Wenn Sie sich von diesen Aufgaben in einer zukunftssicheren Unternehmensgruppe mit großem Marktpotential angesprochen fühlen, dann freuen wir uns, Sie kennenzulernen.
Interesse geweckt?
Für Fragen steht Ihnen die Personalabteilung gerne unter +41 62 866 4156 zur Verfügung. Jetzt bewerben Aenova Group, SWISS CAPS AG, Personalabteilung, Husenstrasse 35, 9533 Kirchberg, Kanton St. Gallen, Schweiz
